sect1.title: Online Ressources
sect1.para: There are several ways to get more info on ELinks online. You might consider to subscribe to one of the mailinglists or join the irc channel.

sect2.title: ELinks Homepage
sect2.para: The ELinks homepage can be found at . Here you'll find the newest releases available for download.

sect2.title: Mailinglists
sect2.para: There are three mailinglists you may consider to subscribe to if you want to stay informed about what is going on.

listitem.para: Releases are announced on this mailing list. Else it is a low-traffic list mostly intended to questions from users and bugreports.
For info about how to subcribe visit http://links.sf.net/mailing.html.
This is the place for discussing the development of ELinks. Make feature requests or send patches for language updates or new features.
For info about how to subcribe visit http://links.sf.net/mailing.html.

For people interested in tracking the development more closely by getting notifications about CVS commits. If you want to know what's actually going on and stay on the cutting edge, you are strongly recommended to subscribe.

Simply mail to links-cvs-subscribe@v.or.cz (subject or content of the mail doesn't matter) and follow the instructions in the reply. If you don't receive any reply within about an hour, please send a mail to pasky@ucw.cz. Note that in the public CVS mirror these changes may first appear up to 15minutes later.

sect2.title: Irc Channel
sect2.para: If you have a question and need a quick reply or just want to meet ELinks developers alive you can join the #elinks channel on irc.openprojects.org.

sect1.title: Bugreporting

epigraph.para: If it breaks you get to keep both pieces.

sect1.para: However if that happens we would very much like to hear about it. Send a detailed bugreport and we might even be able to fix it.
Here is described how to submit a usefull bugreport.
By reporting bugs you help us very much. We appreciate your help!
